content.description: Fun and consistent climb through some side pulls and sloping edges. The slopey corner on the left can be used for extra stability if needed. Great Climb
content.protection: pad and spotter probably. not a very big fall though
content.location: On the southwest face of the Blind Eye. Same start as French Whore, but go up and left following the crimps.

content.description: Super good moves on good rock. Solid slopers all the way through.
content.protection: a pad and spotter wouldn't hurt. though the landing is on a slope...
content.location: Almost at the top of The Blind Eye, climb a sloping arÃªte. Start with both hands about 5 feet up and use heel hooks to work your way up.

content.description: Super solid all the way through. Great problem to warm up on
content.protection: crash pad and a spotter are always handy
content.location: On the southwest face of the Blind Eye. Start on the undercling and go up and right on a sweet flake.

content.description: Interpret the name however you want...but the "B" definitely stands for "big". This is a pretty tall problem with fairly easy moves, with the harder ones being towards the top.
content.protection: Pad and spotter would be wise
content.location: At the Blind Eye area. Located right behind the front side, it is the super tall face with a tree growing right in front
